trans-unit.source: title: OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11 reference
trans-unit.target: title: OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11 reference

trans-unit.source: description: Use these reference topics to look up API mapping and short code samples when porting from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.
trans-unit.target: description: Use these reference topics to look up API mapping and short code samples when porting from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Use these reference topics to look up API mapping and short code samples when porting from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.
trans-unit.target: Use these reference topics to look up API mapping and short code samples when porting from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11.

trans-unit.source: You port your OpenGL Shader Language (GLSL) code to Microsoft High Level Shader Language (HLSL) code when you [port your graphics architecture from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11](port-from-opengl-es-2-0-to-directx-11-1.md) to create a game for Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
trans-unit.target: You port your OpenGL Shader Language (GLSL) code to Microsoft High Level Shader Language (HLSL) code when you [port your graphics architecture from OpenGL ES 2.0 to Direct3D 11](port-from-opengl-es-2-0-to-directx-11-1.md) to create a game for Universal Windows Platform (UWP).
